chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent
Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Evan Jhonthan Charle Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Abandon Veh, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts. Restitution payments will be made at the beginning of each month beginning on September 1, 2022 in the amount of no less than $375 per month.

records.addlTxt:
1:42 PM Defendant Evan Jhonthan Charle Johnson in court.  Attorney Jamy Richard Johansen in court for Evan Jhonthan Charle Johnson.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim appears by video. Court calls case. State indicates will amend Count 1 in 22CF51. in 22cf285, will dismiss Count 3. Count 1 will be a deferred judgment.  On Count 2 recommend 90 days I&S consecutive if revoked, 2 years probation, DOC programming, court costs. On 22CF51, 90 days consecutive to 22CF285 if revoked, I&S 2 years probation, 4 days jail, 4 credit, $50 plus costs. Restitution of $12,190 joint and several with other parties. 
Court recounts charges and possible penalties in both files. Defendant pleads no contest to all counts. Court informs defendant of rights given up by their plea. Attorney stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. Court finds Defendant understands all the rights they are waiving by their plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered. Judgment is deferred on Count 1 in 22CF285.  
State makes statements regarding sentencing. Believes reasonable resolution in this matter.
Attorney Johansen makes statements. Agrees with State. Court makes statements. 

Court orders on 22CF51, 90 days I&S 2 years, conditions 4 days, 4 credit, $50 fines plus costs, Doc programming.  $12,190 restitution. Payments of not less than 375 per month commencing 9/1/22. 
On 22CF285, count 2 90 days jail I&S, consecutive, 2 years concurrent probation. DOC programming, $50 fine plus costs.

9:30 AM Defendant Evan Jhonthan Charle Johnson in court.  Attorney Jamy Richard Johansen in court for Evan Jhonthan Charle Johnson.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney asks for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

9:33 AM Defendant Evan Jhonthan Charle Johnson in court.  Attorney Jamy Richard Johansen in court for Evan Jhonthan Charle Johnson. Attorney Chad C La Lor appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Johnasen received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Close to resolution and requests status in 30 days. Court accepts not guilty plea. State in agreement. State notes victim wants to address Court this am but does not pertain to bail/bond. Court sets status conference. Victim Lucy Mingus makes statement that does not pertain to today's hearing and will wait to discuss at next hearing. Victim asks if she is able to know what negotiations are. Court reviews circumstances and procedure of sharing negotiations.
Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

02:09 PM Defendant Evan Jhonthan Charle Johnson in court.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's address confirmed.  Court recites charges against defendant and possible penalties.  Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney.  States request on bail: $2500 signature bond with conditions of no contact with Lucy Mengas or her 2015 Baxter Ave., Superior, no contact with Co-Defendant with Carson Hamlon.
Defendant has no objections.
Court Orders $2500 signature bond with conditions of no contact with Lucy Mengas or 2015 Baxter Ave, No contact with Carson Hamlon,  No use or possession of alcohol. Victim would not like to address the Court at this time. 
Defendant would like to apply for Public Defender.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 10:45 am.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm for Atty Check
